title: How to Sew a Tea Towel Apron

steps.headline: At the top of the tea towel, sew a tuck about 5 centimeter (2.0 in) in either side.
Sew the tape onto one side, inside the tuck.
On the other tuck, you can sew the tape again to complete the loop, or you can sew a dome that allows for the tape to be attached or wound around.

text: Assemble the things you'll need. They're listed below under "Things You'll Need". At the top of the tea towel, sew a tuck about 5 centimeter (2.0 in) in either side.  Sew the tape onto one side, inside the tuck.  On the other tuck, you can sew the tape again to complete the loop, or you can sew a dome that allows for the tape to be attached or wound around.  Sew tape to either side at waist level to form the waist ties.  Use. The apron is simple to make and when you're tired of using it as an apron, you can transform it back to a tea towel by simply removed the tape and tucks.
